attributes.action: reject the London to Birmingham high speed rail link through the Chiltern Hills and Aylesbury Vale
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The new rail link  will cause "irreversible damage" to many areas deemed Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB).

We oppose the routing of the new high speed rail line through the heart of the Chilterns.

The rail link is of no economic benefit to the Chiltern / Aylesbury Area especially as there is no intermediate station within Buckinghamshire.

Leader of Buckinghamshire County Council, David Shakespeare, said: 'It's ironic that HS2 will give Buckinghamshire all the environmental disadvantages while promoting economic benefits elsewhere. Our residents won't benefit as the trains will pass through the county without stopping, simply leaving Buckinghamshire with huge damage to our environment and Green Belt.'


We implore the Prime Minister to rethink the proposals at the earliest available opportunity and not to destroy this beautiful part of the country.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
